intro: Schellolepis, commonly known as the African rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plants are shrubs or small trees, often characterized by their simple, alternate leaves. Schellolepis species produce small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that is edible and often consumed by local wildlife.
